content.description:
Anchises Discusses Marcellus

Sic pater Anchises, atque haec mirantibusmiror, -ari: to wonder addit: 
“Aspice, ut insignisinsignis, -e, adj.: distinguished spoliisspolium, -i, n.: spoils Marcellus opimisopimus, -a, -um, adj.: rich1
ingredituringredior, -i: to proceed victorque viros supereminetsuperemineo, -ere: to tower above omnes.”
 1:The spolia opima is the term for the armor and weapons won from an enemy general when a Roman general defeated them in personal combat.↩
content.question: The metrical pattern of the first four feet of line 3 (ingreditur...omnes) is

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
